data.text:
Lucinda Shand Kydd1

F, #191071, b. circa 1964

Last Edited=23 Aug 2013

Lucinda Shand Kydd was born circa 1964.1 She is the daughter of William Shand Kydd and Christina Muriel Duncan.1 She married Sir Richard Drake Kleinwort, 4th Bt., son of Sir Kenneth Drake Kleinwort, 3rd Bt. and Lady Davina Rose Pepys, in 1989.1

From 1989, her married name became Kleinwort.1

Children of Lucinda Shand Kydd and Sir Richard Drake Kleinwort, 4th Bt.

Rufus Drake Kleinwort2 b. 16 Aug 1994

Heloise Kleinwort3 b. 28 Feb 1996

Tristan William Kleinwort3 b. 10 Jul 1997

Ivo John Kleinwort2 b. 24 Jun 1999

Citations

[S466] Notices, The Telegraph, London, UK, 17 April 2006. Hereinafter cited as The Telegraph.

[S1122] Peerage News, online http://peeragenews.blogspot.co.nz/. Hereinafter cited as Peerage News.

[S37] BP2003 volume 2, page 2208. See link for full details for this source. Hereinafter cited as. [S37]

Sir Richard Drake Kleinwort, 4th Bt.1

M, #191072, b. 4 November 1960

Last Edited=23 Aug 2013

Sir Richard Drake Kleinwort, 4th Bt. was born on 4 November 1960.1 He is the son of Sir Kenneth Drake Kleinwort, 3rd Bt. and Lady Davina Rose Pepys.2 He married Lucinda Shand Kydd, daughter of William Shand Kydd and Christina Muriel Duncan, in 1989.1

He was educated at Stowe School, Buckingham, Buckinghamshire, England.3 He graduated from Exeter University, Exeter, Devon, England , with a Bachelor of Arts (B.A.)3 He succeeded as the 4th Baronet Kleinwort, of Bolnore, Cuckfield, Sussex [U.K., 1909] in 1994.3 He was chairman of Richard Kleinwort Consultancy Group in 2001.1

Children of Sir Richard Drake Kleinwort, 4th Bt. and Lucinda Shand Kydd

Rufus Drake Kleinwort4 b. 16 Aug 1994

Heloise Kleinwort3 b. 28 Feb 1996

Tristan William Kleinwort3 b. 10 Jul 1997

Tim Atkinson1

M, #191075, b. 8 April 1954

Last Edited=26 Nov 2006

Tim Atkinson was born on 8 April 1954.2 He is the son of Stanley Atkinson and Anne Turner.2 He married, firstly, Susan Margaret Westcott, daughter of S. G. Westcott.2 He married, secondly, Victoria Robina Chenevix Lockyer, daughter of Raymond Robert Lockyer and Frances Robina Chenevix Trench, in 1995.1

He was educated at Exeter School, Exeter, Devon, England .2 He was educated at Birmingham Polytechnic, Birmingham, Warwickshire, England .2 He was educated at Royal Agricultural College, Cirencester, Gloucestershire, England .2

Citations

[S1497] Georgia Chenevix Trench, "re: Trench Family," e-mail message to Darryl Roger Lundy, 16 October 2005. Hereinafter cited as "re: Trench Family."

[S1805] Tim Atkinson, "re: Atkinson Family," e-mail message to Darryl Roger Lundy, 12 July 2006. Hereinafter cited as "re: Atkinson Family."

Samuel Storey, Baron Buckton1

M, #191079, b. 18 January 1896, d. 17 January 1978

Last Edited=24 Feb 2018

Samuel Storey, Baron Buckton was born on 18 January 1896.2 He was the son of Frederick George Storey and Mary Dagmar Hutton.3 He married Elisabeth Woodcock, daughter of Brig.-Gen. Wilfred James Woodcock, on 25 July 1929.2 He died on 17 January 1978 at age 81.1

He was educated at Haileybury College, Haileybury, Hertfordshire, England.3 He graduated from Trinity College, Cambridge University, Cambridge, Cambridgeshire, England, in 1916 with a Bachelor of Arts (B.A.)2 He was admitted to Inner Temple in 1919 entitled to practise as a barrister.2 He graduated from Trinity College, Cambridge University, Cambridge, Cambridgeshire, England, in 1920 with a Master of Arts (M.A.)3 He was member of Sunderland Borough Council between 1928 and 1931.3 He held the office of Member of Parliament (M.P.) for Sunderland between 1931 and 1945.3 He was member of the County Council of East Riding, Yorkshire between 1946 and 1964.2 He held the office of Member of Parliament (M.P.) for Stretford between 1950 and 1966.2 He was created 1st Baronet Storey, of Settrington, East Riding, co. York [U.K.] on 30 January 1960.3 He was created Baron Buckton, of Settrington in the East Riding of Yorkshire [U.K. Life Peer] on 16 June 1966.1

Children of Samuel Storey, Baron Buckton and Elisabeth Woodcock

Hon. Jacquetta Storey+4 b. 19 Apr 1930

Hon. Sir Richard Storey, 2nd Bt.+4 b. 23 Jan 1937
